fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.equipments
Class GenericEquipment

java.lang.Object
  fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.core.network.NetworkEquipment
      fr.univrennes1.cri.jtacl.equipments.GenericEquipment
Direct Known Subclasses:
CiscoRouter, PacketFilter, Pix, SimpleRouter
public class GenericEquipment
extends NetworkEquipment

The generic equipment provides common methods and services for an equipment. You may extend it to implement a new equipment.
It provides:

  • a routing engine and the ability to add routes from the XML configuration file.
  • access to options defined by a pair of key/value (still from XML).

Author:
Patrick Lamaiziere

Constructor Detail

GenericEquipment

public GenericEquipment(Monitor monitor,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String comment,
                        java.lang.String configurationFileName)
Create a new GenericEquipment with this name and this comment.

Parameters:
monitor - the Monitor monitor associated with this equipment.
name - the name of the equipment.
comment - a free comment for this equipment.
configurationFileName - name of the configuration file to use (may be null).

routeDirectlyConnectedNetworks

protected void routeDirectlyConnectedNetworks()
Adds a route for each directly connected network on this equipment.
This method can be called after all interfaces have been added to the equipment.

filter

protected java.lang.String filter(java.lang.String string)
filter out the string in argument according the filters in place.

Parameters:
string - string to filter out.
Returns:
an empty string if the string matches any filter in place, returns the string otherwise.
